Container.Name: Prunerr
Container.Overview:
Prunerr is a media library cleanup and management tool designed to work with Plex, Sonarr, and Radarr.
Features: - Automatic detection of unwatched media - Smart rules engine with flexible conditions - Integration with Sonarr and Radarr for intelligent cleanup - Tautulli integration for watch history analysis - Overseerr integration for request tracking - Configurable retention policies and grace periods - Discord notifications for cleanup actions - Modern web-based dashboard for monitoring and management
Configure your Plex, Sonarr, Radarr, and optionally Tautulli/Overseerr API keys to get started.
Container.Requires: Plex Media Server, Sonarr (optional), Radarr (optional), Tautulli (optional)

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Port for the Prunerr web interface

Config.Name: Data Path
Config.Description: Path to store Prunerr database and configuration. This should be persistent storage.

Config.Name: Plex URL
Config.Description: URL to your Plex Media Server (e.g., http://192.168.1.100:32400 or http://plex:32400)

Config.Name: Sonarr URL
Config.Description: URL to your Sonarr instance. Leave empty to disable Sonarr integration.

Config.Name: Sonarr API Key
Config.Description: Your Sonarr API key. Found in Sonarr under Settings → General → Security.

Config.Name: Radarr URL
Config.Description: URL to your Radarr instance. Leave empty to disable Radarr integration.

Config.Name: Radarr API Key
Config.Description: Your Radarr API key. Found in Radarr under Settings → General → Security.

Config.Name: Tautulli URL
Config.Description: URL to your Tautulli instance (optional). Used for detailed watch history analysis.

Config.Name: Tautulli API Key
Config.Description: Your Tautulli API key. Found in Tautulli under Settings → Web Interface.

Config.Name: Overseerr URL
Config.Description: URL to your Overseerr instance (optional). Used for request tracking and reset.

Config.Name: Overseerr API Key
Config.Description: Your Overseerr API key. Found in Overseerr under Settings → General.

Config.Name: Discord Webhook URL
Config.Description: Discord webhook URL for notifications. Create in Discord Server Settings → Integrations → Webhooks.

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Logging verbosity level: error, warn, info, debug
